message: 123-reg are absolutely dire, their site is terrible and very insecure - but not many providers allow as many records as they do, e.g. Dynadot only allow me three MX records and one TXT record, which just isn't enough sometimes (which is a pity because Dynadot's website is lovely and they've been very reliable)
I use 123-reg for some stuff and Dynadot for others
+1 for zerigo, we have been using it for a while and it is rock solid!
I use zerigo.com. They have a good interface and very reasonable pricing, imho.
I'm using cloudflare.com for dns hosting for lots of sites now. I hate the control panel but I use it for the free web caching they provide
I use and recommend http://dnsimple.com (love the API and ease of use).
all three of those look great
I think dnsimple is most similar to what we're looking for as they handle domain registrations too
I use Dynadot and I'm more than happy with them. Never felt like i needed 'more'.
@craigrood try setting up Google Apps for domains ;)
@ZoFreX I do use Google Apps :)
+1 for Cloudflare, I'm rather fond of the service and was even a tester for them.
Hi
هاي
The Luxembourgian CSIRT has DNS Server for Passive DNS analysis
It's a research project so abuse it ;)
I use No-Ip.com (holdover from when i ran servers on my own pc's at home). Flawless service for 5+ years.
I use dyndns.com.  For my home webserver.
I use easydns.com for dns hosting. been using them for various projects over 5 years now always worked great.
I am also using cloudflare too, but some TLD registers simply doesn't allow their servers
opendns here.
+1 for zerigo.com also
Zerigo
I can't recommend Point enough: http://pointhq.com
@levifig that looks very interesting, cheers
Point give you 10 domains for free, 75 if you pay (£48/yr btw, they don't mention it anywhere on the site)... I'm already managing something like 40 domains overall, 75 isn't exactly far off
I want to pornographic sites free of charge if you allow

Personally I use a dedicated server host, I could run a nameserver of course but I prefer to outsource that knowledge, plus my host isn't a registrar so I still need a 3rd party... it's easier if the registrar and DNS provider are the same
pls excuse the ignorance, but why? don't most (if not all) domain host has dns as well?
its cool to see pointhq supporting SRV records.
Gandi have excellent unrestricted and reliable DNS with all their registrations.  Highly recommended.
Like five years ago I looked up what YC used and went with it.  So, EasyDNS. Pricey but I've never had any issues.
@unwrangle One of the advantages is that if you move hosts, DNS updates don't take that long; and most dedicated DNS services are quicker on the updates as well! ;)
Outbound I use OpenDNS. For my own domains I use rackspace since my domains are hosted there.
